title: SHOUT! POLL: Should Protesters Be Allowed to Shut Down Political Rallies?
subject: Middle-east
short_text: 21st Century Wire asks HAVE YOUR SHOUT: Friday night in Chicago saw an unprecedented incident   where flash mobs from an opposing political party were successful in shutting down a presidential political rally. We ask our readers if protesters should be allowed to shut down political rallies.

title: Palestinian negotiator says 'no talking' with U.S. until Trump reverses Jerusalem decision: Al Jazeera
subject: worldnews
short_text: CAIRO (Reuters) - Palestinian chief negotiator Saeb Erekat told Al Jazeera TV on Friday that the Palestinians will not talk to the United States until President Donald Trump has reversed his decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel s capital, the channel reported. Erekat also said the Palestinian leadership was considering all options in response to Trump s announcement, the channel reported in a newsflash, without giving further details.

title: UK defense minister: PM May decides on cabinet hiring and firing
subject: worldnews
short_text: LONDON (Reuters) - British defense minister Gavin Williamson said on Wednesday it was up to Prime Minister Theresa May to decide who serves in her top team, responding to a question about the political future of aid minister Priti Patel.  The prime minister makes her own decision on actually who is serving in her cabinet, and they re only the prime minister s decisions,  he told reporters in Brussels.

title: NSA director Rogers is top candidate for DNI under Trump: WSJ
subject: politicsNews
short_text: (Reuters) - U.S. National Security Agency Director Admiral Mike Rogers is the leading candidate to become President-elect Donald Trump’s next director of national intelligence, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing two unnamed people familiar with the matter. Rogers met with Trump in New York on Thursday, members of Trump’s transition team said on Friday.

title: Putin, Trump to discuss North Korea on Tuesday: IFX cites Kremlin aide
subject: politicsNews
short_text: MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump will discuss North Korea when they hold a telephone conversation on Tuesday, Interfax news agency cited Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov as saying. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said earlier on Tuesday that the conversation would focus on Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s visit to Russia which he made on Monday.

title: Russian and Chinese heads of state to meet in first half of November
subject: worldnews
short_text: MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday held a telephone conversation with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, and the two leaders agreed to meet in the first half of November, the Kremlin said. The meeting will take place on the sidelines of an Asia-Pacific summit to be hosted by Vietnam, it said.

title: Florida lieutenant governor ends bid for Senate seat
subject: politicsNews
short_text: (Reuters) - Florida’s Republican lieutenant governor, Carlos Lopez-Cantera, on Wednesday dropped his bid for a U.S. Senate seat shortly after Senator Marco Rubio said he would be entering the race. “ I want to congratulate and thank Marco for his decision to pursue re-election to the U.S. Senate,” Lopez-Cantera, a friend of Rubio’s, said in a statement.

title: Cruz campaign vetting Fiorina as a possible VP pick: ABC News
subject: politicsNews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz’s campaign is vetting former business executive Carly Fiorina as a possible vice presidential pick, ABC News said on Friday. Earlier, Cruz’s campaign said it had narrowed its running mate options to a short list.

title: Trump to announce transportation secretary pick: spokesman
subject: politicsNews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President-elect Donald Trump will nominate a transportation secretary on Tuesday afternoon, a spokesman told Fox News, as he continues to fill out his domestic policy team. Trump transition team spokesman Jason Miller said the Cabinet selection would be announced in the early afternoon.

title: U.S. says it will take steps after Cambodia's dissolves opposition party
subject: worldnews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States expressed  grave concern  on Thursday about the Cambodian government s decision to dissolve the main opposition party and said Washington will take  concrete steps  in response, according to a White House statement. As a first step, the White House said, the United States will end its support for the Cambodian National Election Committee and its administration of the 2018 national election.

title: Senate Republican leader says on path toward deal on government funding
subject: politicsNews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday lawmakers and the Trump administration were “on a path” toward reaching a deal on a bill that would keep the government funded beyond Dec. 8. “ That job will have to be done by December the eighth, and I think we’re on a path to do that,” McConnell told reporters, without providing any details.

title: Trump to study tougher Russia sanctions bill: White House
subject: politicsNews
short_text: ABOARD AIR FORCE ONE (Reuters) - President Donald Trump will examine whether a bill toughening sanctions on Russia is offering the “best deal” for the American people, White House spokeswoman Sarah Sanders said on Monday. “ He’s going to study that legislation and see what the final product looks like,” Sanders told reporters during a briefing on Air Force One, when asked whether Trump would support the legislation.

title: U.S. 'very concerned' by violence around Iraq's Kirkuk: State Department
subject: worldnews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. State Department said on Monday Washington was  very concerned  by reports of violence around the Iraqi oil city of Kirkuk, which was seized by Baghdad s forces from Kurds.  We are monitoring the situation closely and call on all parties to coordinate military activities and restore calm,   State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert said in a statement.

title: Trump discusses safe zones in Syria with Jordan's king: White House
subject: politicsNews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump discussed with Jordan’s King Abdullah the possibility of establishing safe zones in Syria, the White House said on Thursday. Trump met with King Abdullah briefly in Washington on Thursday morning, the White House said in a statement.

title: Trump says 'not distracted' by NFL protests
subject: politicsNews
short_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump’s criticisms of National Football League players kneeling in protest during the national anthem have not distracted him from other concerns, he told journalists on Tuesday. “ I wasn’t preoccupied with the NFL.

title: Tillerson says Saudi Arabia not ready for talks with Qatar on Gulf crisis
subject: worldnews
short_text: DOHA (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia is not yet ready to begin direct talks with Doha to resolve the nearly five-month diplomatic and trade cutoff affecting Qatar, U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said on Sunday.  There is not a strong indication that the parties are ready to talk yet,  Tillerson said of discussions he had earlier in the day in Riyadh with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman aimed at overcoming the row.
